name: choucroute
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a dish of cabbage cut into small pieces and preserved in salt, usually heated with wine and eaten with cooked meat: Families gather for hearty meals of smoked pork and choucroute. Alsatian specialities can be found here, such as choucroute.
More examplesFewer examplesThe classic brasserie dish, choucroute, a steaming plate of pickled white cabbage heaped with sausages and pork, originates from Alsace. I know a little restaurant round the corner that serves delicious choucroute garnie. To serve, put a pile of choucroute on each plate and surround with a portion of salmon.
